page.title: 14The growth of houses
page.content: Two of the oldest houses found in our area date back to 1880 and according to one of the occupants were the only houses amidst an area covered by clay and coal pits. They were built by{R. {Stanley,}the owner of the local brickworks,for himself and his general manager. As land became available for house building it eminated from 3 centres:{Nuneaton; Stockingford;}and {Chapel End.}It was largely made up of small terraced houses with accompanying local businesses. These contrast with the more modern estates where virtually every house has its own garage and local amenities are few. The 3 areas mentioned were really cemented together with the building of the vast{Camp Hill}council estate which dominates the area. More private estates are eroding the remaining open and farm land.
